title: Poison Crafting
excerpt: Proficiency with a Poisoner's Kit allows you to create poisons from various materials and handle them safely.
markdown:
# Poison Crafting

Proficiency with a **Poisoner's Kit** allows you to harvest venom and create deadly toxins without risking exposure.

## Tools & Contents
A **Poisoner's Kit** includes 5 glass vials, a mortar and pestle, chemicals, and a glass stirring rod.

## Poison Types
*   **Contact:** Applied to an object or surface; touches bare skin.
*   **Ingested:** Must be swallowed (food/drink).
*   **Inhaled:** Powder or gas; covers a 5ft cube.
*   **Injury:** Applied to weapons/ammo; effect delivered on hit.

## Poison Recipes

### Common Recipes (DC 10)
*Cost: 25 gp + ingredients. Time: 1 workday.*

| Item | Type | Effect | Ingredients |
|---|---|---|---|
| **Basic Poison** | Injury | DC 10 Con save or 1d4 poison damage. Potent for 1 min. | Nightshade |
| **Liquid Paranoia** | Ingested | Frightened of next humanoid seen (1 hour). DC 15 Wis save to halve duration. | Moonstalker |

### Uncommon Recipes (DC 15)
*Cost: 100 gp + ingredients. Time: 3 workdays.*

| Item | Type | Effect | Ingredients |
|---|---|---|---|
| **Assassin's Blood** | Ingested | DC 10 Con save or 1d12 poison dmg + Poisoned (24h). | Basic Poison, Moonshade |
| **Black Paste** | Contact (Clothing) | DC 15 Con save or 1d8 poison dmg; repeat every 12h. | Black Cap Mushroom, Black Sap |
| **Malice** | Inhaled | DC 15 Con save or Poisoned + Blinded for 1 hour. | Morning Dew, Black Sap |
| **Pale Tincture** | Ingested | DC 16 Con save or 1d6 poison + Poisoned. Repeat every 24h, dmg cannot be healed until cured. | Black Sap, Death Cap |
| **Philter of Love** | Ingested | Charmed by next creature seen (1h). | Fairy Stool, Serpent's Venom |
| **Potion of Poison** | Ingested | Looks like healing potion. 3d6 poison dmg + Poisoned. Take 3d6 dmg each turn (save ends). | Potion of Healing, Dreamlilly |
| **Truth Serum** | Ingested | DC 11 Con save or Poisoned (1h); cannot speak lies (*Zone of Truth*). | Fairy Stool, Mindflayer Stinkhorn |

### Rare Recipes (DC 20)
*Cost: 500 gp + ingredients. Time: 10 workdays.*

| Item | Type | Effect | Ingredients |
|---|---|---|---|
| **Burnt Othur Fumes** | Inhaled | DC 13 Con save or 3d6 poison dmg; repeat start of turn (1d6 on fail). Ends after 3 successes. | Ashblossom, Moonshade |
| **Drow Poison** | Injury | DC 13 Con save or Poisoned (1h). Fil by 5+ = Unconscious. | Drider Venom, Mandrake Root |
| **Essence of Ether** | Inhaled | DC 15 Con save or Poisoned + Unconscious (8h). | Nightshade, Mandrake Root |
| **Oil of Taggit** | Contact | DC 13 Con save or Poisoned + Unconscious (24h). | Flask of Oil, Wolfsbane |
| **Torpor** | Ingested | DC 15 Con save or Poisoned + Incapacitated (4d6 hours). | Mandrake Root, Lightning Moss |

### Very Rare Recipes (DC 25)
*Cost: 1,000 gp + ingredients. Time: 30 workdays.*

| Item | Type | Effect | Ingredients |
|---|---|---|---|
| **Midnight Tears** | Ingested | No effect until midnight. DC 17 Con save for 9d6 poison (half on success). | Death Cap, Ankheg Ichor |
| **Deathsleep** | Ingested | DC 19 Con save or Poisoned (24h). Appear dead (Medicine DC 20 to spot). | Tea of Refreshment, Purple Worm Poison |
| **Water of Death** | Injury/Ingested | Looks like water. DC 20 Con save: Blind/Deaf (48h), Pain (24h), Max HP -2d12, 7d10 poison dmg. | Black Cap, Wyvern Poison, Dreamlilly, Hagfinger |

## Harvestable Creature Parts
*Requires Poisoner's Kit unless otherwise noted.*

| Creature | Ingredient | DC | Uses |
|---|---|---|---|
| **Ankheg** (CR 2) | Ankheg Ichor | 15 | Oil of Sharpness, Midnight Tears |
| **Carrion Crawler** (CR 2) | Crawler Mucus | 20 | Acid Resist, Vial of Acid, Oil of Slipperiness |
| **Drider** (CR 6) | Drider Poison | 15 | Drow Poison |
| **Giant Poisonous Snake** (CR 1/4) | Serpent's Venom | 10 | Philter of Love |
| **Giant Toad** (CR 1) | Amphibian Saliva | 15 | Force Resist, Oil of Slipperiness |
| **Purple Worm** (CR 15) | Purple Worm Poison | 20 | Deathsleep |
| **Wyvern** (CR 15) | Wyvern Poison | 15 | Oil of Dragon's Bane, Water of Death |
